resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

nealrichardson commented on issue #4492: ARROW-5509: [R] Add basic write_parquet
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4492#issuecomment-499681459
 
 
   Nice :) For my part, I'm happy as long as the test passes; I think there's some more general refactoring of the reader/writer code ahead, so I'm not inclined to be too picky about the Rcpp code at this point, though that's probably up to @romainfrancois. 
   
   One thing I do see that's left to do here is update the docs. That's `R -e 'devtools::document()'` (https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/r/README.Rmd#L112).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

nealrichardson commented on issue #4492: ARROW-5509: [R] Add basic write_parquet
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4492#issuecomment-499991780
 
 
   Travis seems to want you to lint the .cpp file and add `withr` to Suggests in the DESCRIPTION file (https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/542484998#L2965). You could also get by without `withr` by doing
   
   ```r
   pq_tmp_file <- tempfile() # You can specify the .parquet here but that's probably not necessary
   on.exit(unlink(pq_tmp_file))
   
   write_parquet(df, pq_tmp_file)
   df_read <- read_parquet(pq_tmp_file)
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nealrichardson commented on issue #4492: ARROW-5509: [R] Add basic write_parquet
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4492#issuecomment-501314343
 
 
   @xhochy when you say you ran the usual checks, what do you mean? I'm curious what different people's dev workflows are because it seems that we have a lot of the same logic duplicated in several places (readmes/docs, scripts in `ci/`, docker, etc.), so it's not surprising if those get out of sync. 
   
   Re: parquet, I made it always on in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4371, so in order to install without parquet support, someone would have to edit `r/configure` and install from source. IMO the value of letting someone use the R package without parquet support is much, much lower than the cost of the added complexity, so it would be in our interest to remove the option at some point.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #4492: ARROW-5509: [R] Add basic write_parquet
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4492#discussion_r293588970
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/configure
 ##########
 @@ -25,6 +25,9 @@
 # INCLUDE_DIR and LIB_DIR manually via e.g:
 # R CMD INSTALL --configure-vars='INCLUDE_DIR=/.../include LIB_DIR=/.../lib'
 
+# Fail script on failing commands
+set -e
 
 Review comment:
   I think this is what's causing the [Travis failure](https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/545216104#L740-L741) on the job that build the package without libarrow. pkg-config exists but it isn't finding libarrow, as expected, but the configure script is aborting early. I suspect that if you remove this, we'll get a passing build, and then this can be merged.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description: We can read but not yet write. The C++ library supports this and pyarrow does it.

comments.body: [~romainfrancois] see my PR, I'm already working on this and will continue today.
